{"step_by_step_thinking": "Transmission assessment survey (TAS) is a tool used to determine when infections have been reduced below target thresholds in areas where lymphatic filariasis (LF) is endemic. It is specifically used to assess the impact of mass drug administration (MDA) programs for LF elimination. TAS is not used for assessing primary immunization coverage or providing estimates of birth rate, death rate, and infant mortality rate. Therefore, the correct answer is A. To determine when infections have been reduced below these target thresholds.", "answer_choice": "A"}
